title: 2 Peter: Grow and Guard
objective: Pursue spiritual growth while resisting false teaching through confidence in apostolic truth.

required_passages.text: His divine power has granted to us all things... make every effort to supplement your faith... we did not follow cleverly devised myths... there will be false teachers among you.

segments.audio_script: Peter's final letter combines growth exhortation with urgent warning.

Listen to 2 Peter 1-2. Peter calls believers to maturity by adding virtue, knowledge, self-control, and love. He grounds confidence in eyewitness testimony and prophetic Scripture. He then exposes false teachers marked by greed and immorality, warning of their destructive influence and certain judgment.
Churches faced seductive teaching that denied holiness and distorted grace.
Spiritual stability requires both positive formation and protective discernment. Scripture's reliability anchors believers against doctrinal drift and moral compromise.
Key themes include sanctification, scriptural authority, discernment, judgment, and perseverance.
Reflect on this: Are you intentionally growing in character, or coasting in spiritual passivity?
Grow in grace and guard the gospel. Next, Peter teaches readiness for the day of the Lord.
